{{Talk header}} {{GA|23:22, 26 February 2015 (UTC)|topic=Art and architecture|page=1|oldid=649010374}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST|class=GA|Memorials=y}} {{WikiProject National Register of Historic Places|class=GA|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Wikipedia Saves Public Art|class=GA|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Sculpture}} {{WikiProject United States|class=GA|importance=Low|DC=Yes|DC-importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Visual arts|class=GA}} }} ==Possible sources== * [http://siris-artinventories.si.edu/ipac20/ipac.jsp?session=G1I98048Q3397.39158&menu=search&aspect=Keyword&npp=50&ipp=20&spp=20&profile=ariall&ri=&term=&index=.GW&aspect=Keyword&term=&index=.AW&term=&index=.TW&term=&index=.SW&term=&index=.FW&term=&index=.OW&term=77002026&index=.NW&x=9&y=10#focus "Admiral David G. Farragut, (sculpture)"], Smithsonian American Art Museum * [http://planning.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/op/publication/attachments/Inventory%202009%200%20Alpha%20Version%2003%2011.pdf "District of Columbia Inventory of Historic Sites"], by District of Columbia Office of Planning - Historic Preservation Office, September 30, 2009 * [http://pdfhost.focus.nps.gov/docs/NRHP/Text/78000257.pdf "National Register of Historic Places Inventory--Nomination Form - Civil War Monuments in Washington, D.C."], by Gary Scott, National Park Service, September 19, 1977 * [http://lcweb2.loc.gov/master/pnp/habshaer/dc/dc0700/dc0779/data/dc0779data.pdf "Farragut Square"], by Historic American Buildings Survey, National Park Service * [http://www.nps.gov/nama/blogs/David-Farragut-America-s-First-Admiral.htm "David Farragut: America’s First Admiral"], National Park Service * ''Testament to Union: Civil War Monuments in Washington, D.C.'', by Kathryn Allamong Jacob, JHU Press, Baltimore, 1998, pgs. 101-110, ISBN 9780801858611 * ''The Outdoor Sculpture of Washington, D.C.'', by James M. Goode, Smithsonian Institution Press, Washington, D.C., 1974, pg.101, ISBN 0-87474-149-1 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn86053573/1881-04-25/ed-1/seq-4/# "Farragut Day"], ''National Republican'', April 25, 1881 * [http://query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C02E5DA133FEE3ABC4E51DFB266838A699FDE "The Statue of Farragut"], ''The New York Times'', April 26, 1881 [[User:AgnosticPreachersKid|'''APK''']] [[User talk:AgnosticPreachersKid|'''whisper in my ear''']] 05:04, 14 February 2015 (UTC) == Requested move 12 January 2016 ==
:''The following is a closed discussion of a [[WP:requested moves|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on the talk page. Editors desiring to contest the closing decision should consider a [[Wikipedia:move review|move review]]. No further edits should be made to this section. '' The result of the move request was: '''Moved''' per talk page consensus to [[Admiral David G. Farragut (Ream statue)]]. Will leave the redirect in place for now, but after a major link cleanup, it may be appropriate to redirect [[Admiral David G. Farragut]] to [[David Farragut]] {{rmnac}} [[User:Tiggerjay|Tiggerjay]] ([[User talk:Tiggerjay|talk]]) 01:17, 20 January 2016 (UTC) ---- [[:Admiral David G. Farragut]] → {{no redirect|Admiral David G. Farragut (statue)}} – Farragut himself is still the [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]] for this name. Compare to {{no redirect|General Douglas MacArthur}}, {{no redirect|General Erwin Rommel}}, {{no redirect|Admiral James Stirling}}, etc. [[Admiral David G. Farragut (sculpture)]] would also work. This seems uncontroversial and I'd do it myself if this weren't a GA. I'm surprised this wasn't noticed in GA review. --[[User:BDD|BDD]] ([[User talk:BDD|talk]]) 16:01, 12 January 2016 (UTC) :One thing to keep in mind is that at some time someone (me?) will write an article on [[Augustus Saint-Gaudens]] Farragut statue, which, [[opinion]], is really by far a more important statue in American sculpture history than is Vinnie Ream's one. What is that article to be called? it is already [[a red link]] in St. Gaudens' article as The [[David Farragut Memorial]]. I would suggest that these articles be named [[Admiral David G. Farragut (Ream)]] and [[Admiral David G. Farragut (Saint-Gaudens)]]. Einar aka [[User:Carptrash|Carptrash]] ([[User talk:Carptrash|talk]]) 16:27, 12 January 2016 (UTC) *'''Support a move including statue''' either [[Admiral David G. Farragut (Washington, D.C. statue)]] or [[Admiral David G. Farragut (Ream statue)]] using same recognizable dab as (John Lennon album) ... once you have a dab no need to be cryptic - assuming that Vinnie Ream is known as a mononym like Rembrandt. However [[Admiral David G. Farragut (Saint-Gaudens)]] already exists at [[Admiral David Glasgow Farragut (Manhattan)]]; (Manhattan statue) or (Saint-Gaudens statue) would be more User-friendly. [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 18:26, 12 January 2016 (UTC) ::Thanks {{ping|In ictu oculi}} for tracking down Saint-Gaudens' Farragut article for me. I fixed [[the red link]] in his article, but also thank-you for opening the [[can of worms]] about naming sculpture articles. There is a real mess, for example, in the [[Abraham Lincoln]] statue world that arrises out of the reality that both [[Daniel Chester French]] and Saint-Gaudens both have several of these, SG's two are called 'Standing" and "Seated' except that someone already used [[Seated Lincoln]] for one by [[Gutzon Borglum]] etc. Some sort of standardization seems to be called for. So perhaps we should put out the call to interested folks? [[User:Carptrash|Carptrash]] ([[User talk:Carptrash|talk]]) 01:27, 13 January 2016 (UTC) :::Thanks. I think (Manhattan) suggests a town district, (Ream) etc alone is going to be very unhelpful when we normally have (Dickens novel) etc, so (-- statue) will always be required. [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 08:16, 13 January 2016 (UTC) *'''Support a move''' to [[Admiral David G. Farragut (Ream statue)]]. Carptrash is right about the confusion of Wikipedia articles about Abraham Lincoln statues that are (foolishly) organized by year rather than by sculptor. Would the average reader know the year of Daniel Chester French's ''Seated Lincoln'' at the Lincoln Memorial? By sculptor is the most logical way to go, and add the year or location where there are different statues of the person by the same sculptor.== [[User:BoringHistoryGuy|BoringHistoryGuy]] ([[User talk:BoringHistoryGuy|talk]]) 04:00, 13 January 2016 (UTC) ---- :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of a [[Wikipedia:Requested moves|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on this talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Move review|move review]]. No further edits should be made to this section.
==GA link== {{unresolved}} Does anyone know how to fix the red GA review link in the header? [[Talk:Admiral David G. Farragut/GA1|Here's]] the correct link. [[User:AgnosticPreachersKid|'''APK''']] [[User talk:AgnosticPreachersKid|'''whisper in my ear''']] 23:59, 19 May 2016 (UTC)
